Utterance: Hi there! Welcome back. How did your week go with the mindfulness exercise and your communication goals?
Hey, Ellie! It went pretty well. I tried the breathing exercise a few times, and it really helped me calm down.
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to incorporate that into your routine?
It was refreshing. I felt more centered during conversations, especially with my friends while working on the mural.
That’s great to hear! Did you notice any changes in how you communicated with them?
Yeah, I was definitely more present. I listened more and didn’t interrupt as much.
That’s a significant improvement! How did your friends respond to that change?
They seemed to appreciate it. It made our discussions more productive, and we ended up with some great ideas for the mural.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re building stronger connections. Have you had a chance to talk to Jackrabbit about your feelings?
I did! I told her how much I appreciate her and how she inspires me. It felt good to open up.
That’s a big step! How did she respond?
She was really sweet about it. She said she feels the same way, which made me really happy.
That’s beautiful! It sounds like your connection is deepening. How do you feel about that relationship now?
I feel excited! It’s nice to have someone who understands me.
That’s wonderful! It’s important to have those connections. How about your family? Have there been any updates there?
I called my mom last week. We had a decent conversation, and I tried to be more patient with her.
That’s a positive step! How did that feel for you?
It felt good. I didn’t get as frustrated as I usually do, so that was a win.
It sounds like you’re making progress in that relationship too. What other areas would you like to explore today?
I wanted to talk about my motivation. While I feel inspired, I still struggle to follow through on projects.
That’s a common challenge. What do you think is holding you back from following through?
I think I get overwhelmed by the scope of the project, and then I avoid it.
It’s understandable to feel overwhelmed. Have you tried breaking projects down into smaller, manageable tasks?
I haven’t really done that. I usually just dive in and then get lost.
Breaking tasks down can help make them feel less daunting. Would you like to try that for your mural project?
Yeah, I think that could work. I’ll give it a shot.
Great! Let’s also touch on your sleep habits. Have you been able to maintain a consistent bedtime?
I’ve been trying! I set a reminder on my phone, and it’s helped a lot.
That’s excellent! How have you been feeling overall with your sleep?
I’ve been waking up feeling more refreshed, which is a nice change.
That’s wonderful to hear! Consistent sleep can have a big impact on your mood and energy levels. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think I want to focus on my self-doubt. Sometimes I feel like I’m not good enough, especially in my art.
Self-doubt can be challenging. What triggers those feelings for you?
I think it’s when I compare myself to others or when I feel like my work isn’t as good as theirs.
Comparison can be a slippery slope. Have you considered focusing on your own journey and progress instead?
I’ve tried, but it’s hard to shake off that feeling of inadequacy.
It’s understandable. Perhaps you could keep a journal of your accomplishments and positive feedback from others to remind yourself of your growth.
That sounds like a good idea! I’ll start writing down my achievements.
That’s a great step! Remember, everyone has their own unique path. You have your own strengths and talents to celebrate.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate that reminder.
Of course! As we wrap up, what’s one thing you’d like to focus on before our next session?
I want to keep working on my motivation and try to journal my achievements.
That sounds like a solid plan! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time. Thank you for sharing today.
Thanks, Ellie! See you next time!
